gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ,
or
VB
with
OBJ
and
OBJ

sense.def:
Besedo
give
pogosto uporabljamo s samostalniki, ki opisujejo dejanja, zlasti fizična. Celotni izraz označuje izvajanje dejanja. Na primer:
she gave a smile
ima skoraj enak pomen kot
she smiled
.

seg.quote: Jill gave an immense sigh.
She gave Etta a quick, shrewd glance.
She gave the door a push.
Any aircraft carrying the Prime Minister is given a thorough check.

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ
and
OBJ,
or
VB
with
OBJ
and
PREP
‘to’

sense.def:
Z besedo
give
povemo, da neka oseba opravi določeno dejanje za nekoga drugega. Na primer:
to give someone help
pomeni nekomu pomagati.

seg.quote: He gave her a lift back to London.
...a tutor who came to give lessons to my son.

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ, VB
with
OBJ
and
OBJ,
or
VB
with
OBJ
and
PREP
‘to’

sense.def:
Besedo
give
uporabljamo tudi s samostalniki, ki se nanašajo na informacije, mnenja ali pozdrave. Na primer:
to give someone some news
pomeni nekomu povedati novico.

seg.quote: That's the best advice I can give.
Castle gave the porter the message.
Give my regards to your daughter.

sense.def:
To give a speech or a performance
pomeni govoriti ali nastopiti v javnosti.

seg.quote: He was due to give a lecture that evening.

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ
and
PREP
‘to’,
or
VB
with
OBJ
and
OBJ

sense.def:
To give attention or thought to something
pomeni osredotočiti se na nekaj, obravnavati ali misliti na nekaj.

seg.quote: She hadn't bothered to give it particular thought.

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ
and
OBJ, VB
with
OBJ
and
PREP
‘to’,
or
VB
with
OBJ

sense.def:
To give someone something
pomeni neki osebi nekaj ponuditi v dar in ona to sprejme.

seg.quote: They gave me a handsome little wooden box.
He gave it to me, it's mine.
It was the only thing she had to give.

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ
and
OBJ,
or
VB
with
OBJ
and
PREP
‘to’

sense.def:
To give someone something
pomeni tudi nekomu nekaj izročiti ali priskrbeti.

seg.quote: Give me your key.
...without having been given the opportunity to defend himself.
He gave a card to Beynon.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
gives someone a particular feeling, quality, idea, or right
, povzroči, da imamo ali doživimo neko čustvo, lastnost, zamisel ali pravico.

seg.quote: Working on the car has given me an appetite.
What gave you that idea?
His leadership gives him the right to command.

sense.def:
To give a party
pomeno organizirati zabavo.

seg.quote: Every year he gives a lunch for his family and friends.

sense.def:
Z izrazom
give
tudi povemo, da nekaj ocenjujemo na določeno količino, raven ali vrednost.

seg.quote: The polls had given the President a 10 to 15 point lead.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
gives
, se podre ali zlomi pod pritiskom.

seg.quote: His legs gave beneath him.

sense.def:
Če nekdo reče:
I would give anything to do or have something
ali
I would give my right arm to do or have something
, hoče povedati, da je zelo vnet, da bi nekaj storil ali imel.

seg.quote: She said she would give anything to stay in China.

sense.def:
To give as good as one gets
pomeni, da se v nekem boju ali prepiru bojujemo ali prepiramo enako vneto kot nasprotnik.

Če neka stvar
gives way to another
, jo druga stvar zamenja.

seg.quote: Her look of joy gave way to one of misery.

sense.def:
Če neka zgradba
gives way
, se zruši.

seg.quote: The floor gave way.

sense.def:
To give way to someone
pomeni, da nekomu nekaj dovolimo storiti, čeprav tega v resnici ne želimo.

seg.quote: In the long run it proved easier to give way to his demands.

sense.def:
To give way
pomeni upočasniti vožnjo avtomobila ali ga ustaviti, da drugim vozilom omogočimo, da se vključijo v promet.

Z izrazom
give or take
povemo, da je neka količina izražena približno. Na primer: kadar je nekaj
fifty years old, give or take a few years
, je staro približno petdeset let.

To give something away
pomeni nekomu nekaj dati, pogosto zato, ker tistega ne želimo več.

seg.quote: She has given away jewellery worth millions of pounds.

sense.def:
To give away information
pomeni drugim razkriti podatke, ki bi morali ostati skriti.

To give something back
pomeni nekaj vrniti osebi, ki nam je tisto dala.

seg.quote: If I didn't need the money, I would give it back again.

sense.def:
To give in
pomeni privoliti, da bomo storili nekaj, česar ne želimo storiti, ali sprejeti dejstvo, da tistega ne bomo mogli storiti.

seg.quote: We mustn't give in to threats.
I resolved not to give in.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
gives off heat, smoke, or a smell
, oddaja vročino, dim ali vonj v okolico.

seg.quote: ...the tremendous heat given off by the fire.

sense.def:
To give out a number of things
pomeni razdeliti več stvari osebam v skupini.

seg.quote: Howard gave out drinks to his guests.

sense.def:
Kadar je nekaj
given over to a particular use
, tisto uporabljamo samo v določen namen.

seg.quote: ...land given over to agriculture.

sense.def:
To give up something
pomeni prenehati nekaj delati ali imeti.

seg.quote: He gave up smoking to save money.
She never completely gave up hope.

sense.def:
To give up
pomeni priznati, da ne zmoremo storiti nečesa in da ne bomo več poskušali tistega storiti.

seg.quote: I don't know. I give up.

sense.def:
To give up one's job
pomeni odpovedati službo.
